title: Web Page
description: Details about the web page where a web interaction occurred, as recorded by an `ExperienceEvent`.

xdm:siteSection.title: Site Section
xdm:siteSection.description: The normative name of the site section where this web page resides, which may be used to classify or categorize the interaction

xdm:name.title: Name
xdm:name.description: The normative name of the web page. This name is not necessarily the page title or directy associate with page content, but is used to organize a site's pages for classification purposes

xdm:URL.title: URL
xdm:URL.description: The normative or usual URL of the web page.  This may or may not be the actual URL used to reach the page, which would be recorded using `WebLink`.

xdm:server.title: Server
xdm:server.description: The normative or usual server that hosts the web page.  This may or may not be the host or server that actually served the page interaction, but is used for classification purposes.

xdm:isErrorPage.title: Is Error Page
xdm:isErrorPage.description: Flag that indicate if the page is error page or not.  Error here is defined by the application, and may nor may not correspond to a page served with an HTTP error code.  This flag is used to broadly categorize web interactions.

xdm:isHomePage.title: Is Home Page
xdm:isHomePage.description: Flag that indicate if the page is the site home page or not.  The definition of home page is determined by the application, but is commonly used to designate a top level landing page or common site entry point.  This flag is used to broadly categorize web interactions.

xdm:referrer.title: Referrer
xdm:referrer.description: The referrer of the web page, which is the URL a visitor came from immediately before the current web interaction was recorded

meta:enum.internal: Referral originated from the current domain or site.
meta:enum.external: Referral originated from a different domain or site that was not a search or social type.
meta:enum.searchEngine: Search engine referrers are identified when visitors use a search engine to access the site.
meta:enum.typedBookmarked: Typed/bookmarked referrers are identified when visitors type your siteâ€™s URL directly into their browser, or if they access the site by selecting bookmarks.
meta:enum.email: A referring domain is considered as an email referring domain type when visitors click an emailed message link containing the protocol imap:// or mail:// and arrive at the site.
meta:enum.social: The referrer is identified as a social network.
